website_summaries.verdict: Includes built-in Bluetooth connectivity, ensuring you're able to use this versatile amplifier in the most convenient way.
pros: Small amplifier can fit almost anywhere, making it a smart choice for many vehicle types, including boats, ATVs, and motorcycles
Ships with a remote control unit to manage the Bluetooth settings
Printed circuit boards have a coating to protect them from possible moisture damage
cons: Only a maximum of 400 watts, so it may not meet the needs of everyone well

customer_reviews.title: The bluetooth connection is very easy.
customer_reviews.text: I put this amp on my 2015 harley Road king. I used some wakeboard speakers on my engine guards. My wife and I can here our music going 80 on the highway. I'm going to add speaker lids soon. The bluetooth connection is very easy.
customer_reviews.author: John Blanco

customer_reviews.title: Used this in my RWD TXR fairing for harley
customer_reviews.text: Awesome amp..incredibly easy hookup killer RMS output amd a very nice remote. Its everything you need in one package. I would recommend still wiring in a fuse on the 12v main power..the amp is fused but always good practice to still have inline power fuse. I would recommend this amp over others if your running a couple speaker system. This paired with some kicker speakers and I can hear my two 6.5 speakers clearly at 80mph. It's a Kenwood amp..kenwood makes great products they always have.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Good small bluetooth amp.  Pushes my kickers just fine.
customer_reviews.text: I installed a tablet instead of a head unit in my Silverado and used this to power some cheap kicker replacement doors speakers. Sounds great, and it fits behind the tablet. I 3d printed by own bracket as the factory one was too bulky and didn't fit where I wanted it. All in all for a refurb it looked brand new. I only wish I could turn down the brightness of the controller or have it tied into my brightness of the vehicle like other head units.
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money or time
customer_reviews.text: The 1st one I bought quit working all together all of a sudden, luckily I was still in the time frame to return and receive a replacement. The 2nd amplifier I received did the same thing and stopped working altogether after 3 trips out on the boat as well but unfortunately this time I was not able to return the it. The amp is great when it works but obviously its not worth the money time or effort. followed all directions installed in a dry location, and performed troubleshooting before throwing in the towel. Dont wast your money.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Faust II

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed. When I first saw it’s small overall size and small wire size I was tempted to return it. But it’s been working great, and is loud enough to hear in an open cab at highway speeds with ear plugs in. It’s a little annoying how it starts playing every time it gets power, like when working on the electrical system. But that’s really not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: matthew noble

customer_reviews.title: Easy install
customer_reviews.text: The wiring diagram is pretty straight forward and I was able to installand operate the amplifier without the use of a traditional radio head unit. I now enjoy the ability to connect my phone via bluetooth to the speakers to play music or I've also wired in a 3.5mm audio jack. I'm not sure if it will function without the remote, but it appears you need the remote to switch between inputs if not connected to a kenwood head unit.
customer_reviews.author: JessMess

customer_reviews.title: Overall Excellent Kenwood quality, as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Overall excellent Kenwood quality but keep in mind that you won't have any pre-amp controls so you will either have to use the LINE-OUTs or go back to old-school cap and coil for a cross over, as there are no high-pass or low-pass controls built into the amp, nor any gain controls, just a fader between the a and b channels. I ended up digging through the archives and ran caps & coils for mine. I also found that the POWERAMP app worked quite well for adding some bass-trebel or eq settings for further refinement as a bluetooth music player.
customer_reviews.author: Beau F.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t disappoint!
customer_reviews.text: Was kind of skeptical of such a small amp to deliver enough power but i am NOT disappointed. Used it in my 77 trans am to add Bluetooth function. I was afraid it wouldn’t be loud enough to hear with the windows down but it definitely is. I can see why motorcyclists like it. Remote is easy to use, even sounds good with my factory radio (which was modified to have line level outputs). Very pleased though. Will recommend to other car guys/girls and would probably pick up another one if I had a use for it.
customer_reviews.author: BAH8688

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Product was totally defective. Would not power on. Contacted seller to request refund. Was informed I could request another unit or I would need to pay to have it returned. I inquired as to why I would need to pay to return a defective unit and take the chance the next unit would also be defective. Ended up costing an additional $15 to send back their defective product.
customer_reviews.author: Ty S.

customer_reviews.title: Great way to add music w/o needing a tuner - works very well - highly recommended!

Bluetooth and the remote switch worked easily on both my iPhone and my Galaxy S4. The USB port is for charging only, which is too bad, as a direct hook-up for a thumb drive with music would make this perfect. I took this on a 4,500 mile trip recently and it did really well in all sorts of weather.

(Dyna Street Bob) hooked up 2 90w rms each speakers. It’s loud! They’re only 5.25 speaker this amp could and will probably end up blowing the speakers! I’m happy and it comes with a USB port to charge my phone! Would highly recommend and would most definitely buy again!!!
customer_reviews.author: edwin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on my boat for the entire purpose of removing the requirement to have a head unit. Unit works perfectly w/o the head unit, connects to my phone via bluetooth effortlessly, maintains that connection from anywhere on the boat. The sound is superb and a great leap forward from a smaller head unit. ZERO "whine" (ground noise). The wired remote is installed in my console and currently works fine....but we'll see after it smells the salt air for a year.

So Now I’m stuck with it. Ended up having to use it solely as a Bluetooth transmitter, it now powers zero speakers. If you buy this amp, maybe buy it elsewhere.

The only ding I could possible make is I wish the remote control was wireless else I would have removed the head unit altogether.

customer_reviews.text: I have two of these. One on my four wheeler and one on my jet ski. The sound is pretty good but the performance is lacking. On both vehicles, I have problems with the amp cutting out when the volume is too high. Its not even that high, but I have to lower the volume so it doesn't start rebooting or disconnecting during my songs. I think this amp may have just died on me yesterday too in my ski. Can't blame the amp yet, I need to take it apart to be sure, but there is no signal or power and battery connections are good. I'm looking at JL or even Rockford as a replacement.

customer_reviews.title: When bridged, the BT Signal is in Stereo
customer_reviews.text: I installed on a 2019 Road King with Kicker PSM3 4 Ohm. The amp is bridged two channel and the speakers sound incredible. This set-up replaced a Boss Audio 420 system. The amp and kickers sound more powerful and crisper with a little more punch. It is best to use this combo bridged. I tried it in 4 channel mode and there was not enough power to the speakers above 80% volume level. Bridged, it was perfect up to 100% volume and LOUD!. As my title states, the system when bridged converts the front to channel 1 and the rear to channel 2. The blue tooth signal is splits left/right into channel 1/2 respectively - maintaining stereo separation.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound. Easy to install. Simple Bluetooth connection and nice remote.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent clean Bluetooth sound with 8" Kickers. Nice wired remote. Be weary of too much movement at the remote's connection to the amp. It should be fine if you stabilize the remote cable somewhere near the amp but I would restrict any wire movement near the connector with wire ties so you don't pull on the small connector. I also question if the connections are truly of boating quality, and doubt they will handle salt water for very long. If you install on a salt water boat, I also suggest you use dielectric grease on every connection, and keep the unit protected very well.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a motorcycle

The controller is nice and small so it's doesn't look out of place on a motorcycle. It mounts easy but my only complaint is it doesn't lock into the controller dock,it just kinda sits in it. I'll probably use double sided tape inside of the dock to keep it from slipping out while riding. It also comes with ALL wiring that is needed

product_meta.title: Kenwood 1177524 Compact Automotive/Marine Amplifier Class D Kac-M1824BT, 180W RMS, 400W PMPO, 4 Channel
product_meta.description: With today's smartphones hosting a wide variety of listening choices such as stored music, internet radio, podcasts, etc., It is no wonder that customers want to use this as their primary listening source. Bluetooth offers the easiest and most popular connection, kac-m1824bt is not only your standalone Bluetooth gateway but if used with an in-dash receiver, it will double the power of a typical CD receiver with it's built-in 45watts x 4 of amplification. A water resistant controller can be used to adjust volume and change tracks. Many of today's power sports have very limited space to work in and tend to be a harsh environment for electronics because of the exposure to outdoor environments. Kenwood's compact performance amplifiers are small in size so they fit even the most limited installation areas. The amplifiers also use a conformal coated main pcb (printed circuit boards) which offer extra layers of protection to help prevent moisture or damp air from damaging the product.
